title: Google logo redrawn by thousands of kids
content:
Don’t miss the thousands of creative [interpretations of one logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336/http:/www.google.com/doodle4google/finalists.html) from kids 18 and under. All the entries are organized geographically. It’s a very interesting project!

This is the winner:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/us_doodle4google08_3571.gif)

Some of my favorites:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/CT-06422-66d9f560-2_4863.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NV-89002-be03a63d-1_6664.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/MA-01604-2c31df67-2_5655.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/AZ-85297-0d284467-1_3923.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/CA-95126-ecc49fe0-3_5520.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NJ-07078-33051e0f-5_3427.jpg)

(Everybody post your favorites!)

 [‹ Rosie the Riviter Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45746 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font Identification ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45732 "Go to next forum topic")
author: EileenB

comments.content:
Here’s the holiday logos: [http://www.google.com/holidaylogos.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336/http:/www.google.com/holidaylogos.html "http://www.google.com/holidaylogos.html")

Where did you get the others. We need to get a link to them.

I linked the text in the first sentence, do you not see that?  
Here’s the link again: [http://www.google.com/doodle4google/finalists.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190336/http:/www.google.com/doodle4google/finalists.html "http://www.google.com/doodle4google/finalists.html")
Getting kids to draw doodles of your logo — tasteful.
Getting kids to love your brand — priceless.
Getting kids to draw|love|wear your brand - Disney
Letting people mess around with your branding - cool & unusual.

google has a long history of updating their logos with festive logos for special days, I wish more comanies did this.

google has such a potential to be big brother, but when I see them getting kids involved, putting thousands into open-source get get better software to people who can’t afford any, I’m glad we have them
